title: Is it impossible to get a S from a defeat ?
body: I played a game and my score was ok 15/5/5 and my team won. I then played a game which i loss and my score was good 21/6/12. I had around 300 cs in both games, but the difference between the games was that i got a S on the 15/5/5 one and got a S- on the other. I am trying to get m7 tokens and i noticed in my past m7 token grindings that no matter how good your score is you will never get a S if you lose the game. Is this true?

replies.body: It should still be theoretically possible to get an S or even S+ when you lose a game, since those scores are based on individual play and not team play.
Why say “theoretically?” This makes it seem like it's never happened before, but I know it has.
Because words are words and I like that one xP

If you go like 10-0-7 KDA as a Renekton top lane (just for example) and your CS is relatively close to 10 per minute (like 6-8 seems reasonable depending on the game and the skill level the game thinks you're at), then I'd say an S- is possible and an S would be extremely hard to get.  S+ in a losing game seems unthinkable unless it's a really long game and you're a diamond/master/challenger (MAYBE plat)  player who makes virtually no mistakes across the board in everything. 

It also depends on what champion you're playing and how many other people have gotten S grades with that champion before.  I suspect that the game has a bit of machine learning when it comes to tracking individual champion performance.  S grades this year seemed far easier to get in the preseason and at the start of season 7 than they have been the past couple months.

I've personally received an S in a losing game before, so it's possible, although improbable.

I'm pretty sure win/loss is a factor towards grade directly so with equal stats the win will be otherwise better, but besides that when you lose you tend to have lower statistics all around.
